a is {{c1::Pronator teres}};      b is {{c1::Flexor carpi radialis}},      c is {{c1::Flexor digitorum superficialis}},       d is {{c1::Flexor carpi ulnaris}};   e is {{c1::brachioradialis}}
Pronator teres|Flexor carpi radialis|Flexor digitorum superficialis|Flexor carpi ulnaris|Brachioradialis

The superficial muscles in the anterior compartment are Pronator teres , flexor carpi radialis, Flexor carpi ulnaris, flexor digitorum superficialis. They all originate from a common tendon, which arises from the medial epicondyle of the humerus.
